body: The following feats are available to ogres.
name: Ogre Feats

sections.body: You have sickened, rotting flesh from some deformity or vestigial limb that has turned fetid and necrotic, yet refuses to heal or fall off.
sections.name: Corrupted Flesh

sections.body: Con 15, 6 HD, ogre.
sections.name: Prerequisites

sections.body: You gain the stench special ability (DC 10 + 1/2 your HD + your Constitution modifier).
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: The rotting of your flesh has spread to your lungs and fills them with putrid fluids.
sections.name: Fetid Breath

sections.body: Con 15, Corrupted Flesh, 6 HD, ogre.
sections.name: Prerequisites

sections.body: You can exhale a 30-foot cone of vile-smelling, moist air mixed with phlegm and remnants of old meals. Creatures in the area must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your Hit Dice + your Constitution modifier) or they are nauseated for 1d6 minutes. Affected creatures that spend a full-round action gasping for fresh air and scraping off your oral debris may attempt another save to overcome the effect. You can use this breath weapon twice per day, plus one additional time per day for every 6 HD you possess beyond 6.
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: Some ogres are able to quickly choke down even the largest of meals so they can get on with other business.
sections.name: Gluttonous Gobbler

sections.body: Both Improved Unarmed Strike and Improved Grapple or the grab ability, ogre, size Large or larger.
sections.name: Prerequisites

sections.body: If you start your turn grappling another creature at least two size categories smaller than you, you can put the grappled creature in your mouth as a move action and attempt another grapple combat maneuver check (as though attempting to pin the opponent). If you succeed, you swallow the opponent as if you had the swallow whole special ability.
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: You excel at hunting humans in the dead of night and murdering them quietly.
sections.name: Night Stalker

sections.body: Skill Focus (Stealth), darkvision, half-ogre or ogre, size Large or larger.
sections.name: Prerequisites

sections.body: While in areas of dim lighting or natural darkness, you ignore all size penalties on Stealth checks and gain a +2 bonus on attack rolls against flat-footed enemies.
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: Your thick, muscular arms are capable of landing powerful blows and crushing the life out of the smaller creatures you embrace.
sections.name: Ogre Crush

sections.body: Str 25, Improved Grapple, Improved Unarmed Strike, ogre, size Large or larger.
sections.name: Prerequisites

sections.body: Your unarmed strike damage increases by one step when you're grappling creatures smaller than you. You gain the constrict monster special ability, dealing an amount of damage equal to either the slam damage for a creature of your size or your unarmed strike damage, whichever is greater.
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: You are able to harness the rage that burns inside you and fuels your might.
sections.name: Raging Brute

sections.body: Str 21, ogre.
sections.name: Prerequisites

sections.body:
Select one rage power. Once per day as a free action, you can enter a state of fury and gain the effects of this rage power for 1 minute. If the rage power normally ends a barbarian rage when used, the ability ends after it's used and you immediately become fatigued. You don't otherwise become fatigued at the end of this ability's duration.

Your effective barbarian level for the purpose of qualifying for and using rage powers is equal to your total Hit Dice – 3. This feat doesn't grant any of the normal benefits or penalties of a barbarian's rage.
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: You can take this feat multiple times. Each time you do, choose another rage power and gain one additional use per day of this feat. Each time you activate this feat, you can use any or all of your rage powers gained from this feat.
sections.name: Special

sections.body: You are able to land critical hits precisely, dealing devastating damage.
sections.name: Savage Critical

sections.body: Str 19, ogre, sneak attack +2d6.
sections.name: Prerequisites

sections.body: When you hit a creature using the Vital Strike feat or confirm a critical hit against an opponent, add your sneak attack damage to the damage from the attack. This feat has no effect on attacks that already allow you to add sneak attack damage.
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: You were born with a parasitic vestigial head with its own stunted brain. The head may be mostly subsumed within your own flesh and visible only as a distorted face, or it might sprout out of its own neck from your neck, shoulder, back, or chest.
sections.name: Vestigial Head

sections.body: Ogre.
sections.name: Prerequisite

sections.body: Anytime you must attempt a Will save against a hostile effect, there is a 25% change that the effect targets your vestigial head instead. If this occurs, you are treated as if you had succeeded at your saving throw, and instead are sickened for 1d4 rounds or the duration of the effect (whichever is longer).
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: You can take this feat twice. The second time you do, the chance of a hostile Will effect targeting your vestigial head instead of your own increases to 50%. This doesn't give you another vestigial head.
sections.name: Special
